00006 #include "maven.h"
00007 #include "struct_StringList.h"
00008 #include "struct_MavenCompiler.h"

00010 #include "errors.h"
00011 #include "namespaces.h"
00012 #include "constants.h"

00014 using namespace std;
00015 
00016 bool keywordEnum(MavenCompiler* c, string identifier, string code) {
00017         identifier = trim(identifier);
00018         code = trim(code);
00019         MavenEnum e;
00020         
00021         // get the enum name
00022         e.name = trim(identifier.substr(4, identifier.length() - 4));
00023 
00024         // bug #30: make sure the enum doesn't already exist
00025         for(int i = 0; i < c->namespaces->at(findNamespaceID(c, c->currentNamespace)).enums.size(); ++i) {
00026                 if(c->namespaces->at(findNamespaceID(c, c->currentNamespace)).enums[i].name == e.name) {
00027                         pushError(c, "Enum '%s' already defined", e.name);
00028                         return false;
00029                 }
00030         }
00031         
00032         // split and process the items
00033         StringList elements = splitCommas(code);
00034         if(trim(code) == "") {
00035                 pushError(c, "The enum '%s' must be defined with at least 1 element", e.name);
00036                 return false;
00037         }
00038         
00039         for(int i = 0; i < elements.length(); ++i) {
00040                 // bug #31: get the 'default'
00041                 MavenEnumItem item;
00042                 
00043                 StringList parts = split('=', elements[i]);
00044                 
00045                 // check if this is a default item
00046                 string itemname = trim(parts[0]);
00047                 if(itemname.length() > 7 && itemname.substr(0, 7) == "default") {
00048                         // make sure there is only 1 default item
00049                         for(int j = 0; j < e.items.size(); ++j) {
00050                                 if(e.items[j].isDefault) {
00051                                         pushError(c, "There may only be 1 default element in the enum '%s'", e.name);
00052                                         return false;
00053                                 }
00054                         }
00055                         
00056                         item.isDefault = true;
00057                         itemname = trim(itemname.substr(7, itemname.length() - 7));
00058                 }
00059                 
00060                 // make sure the item doesn't already exist
00061                 for(int j = 0; j < e.items.size(); ++j) {
00062                         if(e.items[j].name == itemname) {
00063                                 pushError(c, "Duplicate element name %s in enum %s", itemname, e.name);
00064                                 return false;
00065                         }
00066                 }
00067                 item.name = itemname;
00068                 
00069                 // get the manual value
00070                 if(parts.length() > 1) {
00071                         string p = trim(parts[1]);
00072                         
00073                         // make sure the manual value is in an acceptable format
00074                         if(isNumber(p) || p == "true" || p == "false") {
00075                                 string type = getConstantType(p);
00076                                 if(type != "int" && type != "boolean")
00077                                         pushWarning(c, "Non-int in manual value for enum element '%s.%s'", e.name, item.name);
00078                                 
00079                                 if(p == "true") item.value = 1;
00080                                 else if(p == "false") item.value = 0;
00081                                 else item.value = atoi(p.c_str());
00082                         } else if(p.length() > 2 && p[0] == '\'' && p[p.length() - 1] == '\'') {
00083                                 item.value = charToInt(p.substr(1, p.length() - 2));
00084                         } else {
00085                                 pushError(c, "Invalid manual value for enum element '%s.%s', must be int", e.name, item.name);
00086                                 return false;
00087                         }
00088                 } else item.value = i;
00089                 
00090                 e.items.push_back(item);
00091         }
00092         
00093         // push whole enum
00094         c->namespaces->at(findNamespaceID(c, c->currentNamespace)).enums.push_back(e);
00095         
00096         return true;
00097 }
